intro: Ixora odorata, commonly known as the sweetshrub, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant, orange-red flowers. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its aromatic properties. Ixora odorata thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
